topic.title: Using the Mac OS X installer
topic.shortdesc: How to install the FusionInventory agent using the Mac OS X installer.

body.p: The FusionInventory project provides two Mac OS X packages, one for PowerPC processors, the other for Intel processors.

The package is a .pkg file designed for silent installations. The agent configuration needs to be done prior to installation, by editing the Content\Resources\agent.cfg file (located into the package).
By default, the agent runs as a daemon, and stores its files in /opt/fusioninventory-agent.
body.note: the FusionInventory agent is not a Mac OS X application, and as such is invisible for the user.
body.p: Once configured, the agent can be deployed either manually (by double clicking on the .pkg file) or automatically using tools like Apple Remote Desktop.
